criterion: Reward for accurately capturing the patient's main concern that rheumatoid arthritis pain has intensified and fear that hydroxychloroquine may be insufficient
Reward for faithfully documenting the clinician's stated management plan: give hydroxychloroquine more time, monitor pain closely, and consider dose adjustment or alternative options if pain persists
Reward for including the medication-adherence detail that the patient takes folic acid daily, influenced by a support group, exactly as expressed
Reward for correctly listing current medications and pertinent allergy drawn from the chart when—and only when—relevant to the conversation, with accurate names and dosages
Reward for overall completeness: the note contains all clinically relevant statements and contextual details explicitly or implicitly present in the entire transcript, with none omitted
Penalize for introducing information not present in either the transcript or chart (e.g., new symptoms, diagnoses, labs, physical-exam findings, or altered medication doses)
